attributes.action: stop TFLs proposed £25 per day congestion charge band.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
TFL/Ken Livingstone have today announced a £25 per day band for the congestion charge. The £25 charge will apply to vehicles emitting more than 225 grams of CO2 per kilometre (g/k), as well as those registered before March 2001 which have engines larger than 3,000cc

There are obviously well intentioned reasons for this, but like various other car legislation it is too emcompassing and indiscrimative including large amounts of Londoners who can ill afford another £25 per day! As a quick estimate - this could cost some people up to £6000 a year on top of road tax, and fuel duty that they already pay!
